name: Little House in the Big Woods Part 1 Quiz  | 15 Questions

questions.text: What did Laura call her mother and father?
questions.explanation:
Ma and Pa.

	In the 19th century most children in the United States called their parents ma and pa.  No one hardly calls their parents ma and pa anymore, but there are still alot of grandmas and grandpas floating around.

questions.text: When was "Little House in the Big Woods" first published?
questions.explanation:
1932.

	It was published by HarperCollins.  Laura wrote all of her books at Rocky Ridge Farm in Mansfield, Missouri.

Jack.

	Jack was a brindle bulldog.  Laura knew as long as Jack was there she would always be safe.

questions.text: What kind of wood chips would Pa use to smoke the vension?
questions.explanation:
hickory chips.

	Pa had to make sure that he used green hickory chips so that the chips would smolder and fill the log with smoke instead of burning away quickly.

questions.text: Besides the bladder that they used as a balloon, what other part of the pig did Laura and Mary look forward to getting when it was butchering time?
questions.explanation:
the pig's tail.

	Laura thought roasting the pig's tail was so much fun that she had a hard time taking turns.  When the tail was all roasted, Laura and Mary would take it outside to cool so they could eat it.  They never let it completely cool and would burn their tongues, but they didn't care.  When they ate all the meat off of the bone, they gave the bone to Jack.

questions.text: When Pa shot a bear one evening, what part of the bear did Mary say that she wanted?
questions.explanation:
the drumstick.

	I want the drumstick! I want the drumstick!  Of course, Mary didn't realize how large a bear's drumstick really is.

questions.text: Who did Ma say made the frost pictures on the windows in the wintertime?
questions.explanation:
Jack Frost.

	Laura thought Jack Frost was a little bity man all covered in white, who had sharp tools to carve the pictures in the frost.

questions.text: Ma said that each day had its own proper work.  What day did they do the washing?
questions.explanation:
Monday.

	Wash on Monday. Iron on Tuesday.  Mend on Wednesday.  Churn on Thursday.  Clean on Friday.  Bake on Saturday.  Rest on Sunday.  Laura's favorite days were churning and baking days.

questions.text: What vegetable did Ma use to color the winter butter so it would be the same pretty yellow that the summer butter was?
questions.explanation:
carrot.

	After Ma grated a carrot she put it in a little pan of milk on the stove.  When the milk was hot she poured it and the carrot into a cloth bag.  She would then squeeze the bright yellow milk into the cream and that is what colored the butter.

questions.text: What was Pa's nickname for Laura?
questions.explanation:
Half-pint.

	Pa would come in and ask, "Where's my little half-pint of sweet cider half drunk up?"

questions.text: What was one of Laura and Mary's favorite games to play with Pa?
questions.explanation:
mad dog.

	Pa would run his hand through his hair and make it stand on end.  He would then get down on his hands and knees, start growling and chase the girls all over the room trying to corner them.

questions.text: What was Pa's bullet pouch made of?
questions.explanation:
buckskin.

	Ma made Pa a bullet pouch from a buck he had shot.  In those days very little of any animal killed was wasted.

questions.text: What did Ma hit to get it to move out of the way of the barn gate?
questions.explanation:
a bear.

	I was dark outside and Ma went out to do the milking.  She thought she saw their cow and slapped it to get it to move out of the way.  It turned out to be a bear.

questions.text: What did Laura get for Christmas that she was so proud of?
questions.explanation:
a rag doll.

	Her doll had a face of white cloth with black button eyes.  Her eyebrows were made with a black pencil.  Her cheeks and mouth were made with pokeberry ink.  Her hair was black yarn that had been knitted and made curly.  She named her Charlotte.  Fun Fact:  Laura's maternal grandmother's name is also Charlotte.

questions.text: What was Laura's least favorite day of the week?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	Even though Laura enjoyed the Bible stories that she was told, she so hated to be still.  She had to be still all day and could not play.  She was allowed to talk to her rag doll, but that was it.  At night when they went to bed, Pa would put them to sleep playing hymns on his fiddle.
